Package ch.mazluc.game

Class ANSIUtils

java.lang.Object
ch.mazluc.game.ANSIUtils
public class ANSIUtils extends Object

Utility class for ANSI escape sequences. Implements methods for setting background and foreground colors, moving the cursor, clearing the screen, and resetting the output format. Color codes are defined as constants and color codes with 16 or 256 bit format are not supported.

  • Find out more at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code;
  • GitHub Repo: https://github.com/lucamazzza/ANSIUtility;

Usage: 

 
 ANSIUtils.clearScreen(); // clear the screen
 ANSIUtils.moveTo(10, 10); // move the cursor to row 10 and column 10
 ANSIUtils.setForegroundColor(ANSIUtils.RED); // set the foreground color to red
 ANSIUtils.setBackgroundColor(ANSIUtils.YELLOW); // set the background color to yellow
 System.out.println("Hello, World!"); // print "Hello, World!"
 ANSIUtils.reset(); // reset the output format
Version:
1.0
Author:
Luca Mazza

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public static void reset()
      Resets the output format to the default.

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the screen

    • setBold

      public static void setBold()
      Sets the output format to bold.

    • setNormal

      public static void setNormal()
      Sets the output format to normal.

    • moveTo

      public static void moveTo(int row, int col)
      Moves the cursor to the specified position, based on row and column. Coordinates are specified starting from 1, where 1,1 is the top left corner of the screen. If the cursor is already at the specified position, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      row - the vertical coordinate
      col - the horizontal coordinate

    • setForegroundColor

      public static void setForegroundColor(int code)
      Define the foreground color at the next prints. The parameter code must be a valid color code (i.e. one of the constants defined in this class). If the color code is invalid, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      code - the color code

    • setBackgroundColor

      public static void setBackgroundColor(int code)
      Sets the background color.
      Parameters:
      code - the color

    • setColor

      public static void setColor(int bg, int fg)
      Sets the foreground and background color. The parameters fg and bg must be valid color codes (i.e. one of the constants defined in this class). If the color codes are invalid, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      bg - the background color
      fg - the foreground color
